name: cfproperty
description:
Defines properties of a CFML component (CFC). Used to
 create complex data types for web services. The attributes of
 this tag are exposed as component metadata and are subject to
 inheritance rules.

params.name: name
params.description: Specifies the name of the property.

params.name: type
params.description: Specifies the ColdFusion data type for the property.

params.name: required
params.description: Whether the parameter is required

params.name: default
params.description: This sets the default value on the property when the object is created. For ORM Entities, this only works for static values. Variable values like the current timestamp can be set by a function "preInsert" in the component.

params.name: displayname
params.description:
A value to be displayed when using introspection to show
 information about the CFC. The value appears in parentheses
 following the property name.

params.name: hint
params.description:
Text to be displayed when using introspection to show
 information about the CFC. This attribute can be useful
 for describing the purpose of the parameter.

params.name: fieldtype
params.description:
This attribute is used to specify the type of the property. Use this attribute to specify the following:
* Primary key: Specify fieldtype = "id" to map a property to the primary key in the table. 
* Column: Specify the fieldtype = "column" to map a property to a column in the table.
* Relationship: Specify the fieldtype = "relationship_type". The relationship_type can be one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one, or many-to-many.
* Version: Specify the fieldtype="version‚Äù to indicate that the column contains versioned data.
* Timestamp: Specify the fieldtype="timestamp" to indicate the column contains data with timestamp.
* Collection: Specify the fieldtype="collection" to define the collection mapping.

params.name: ormType
params.description:
Used to specify the data type of the primary key. If data type is not set and the ORM setting
useDBForMapping=true, then the ormtype is determined by inspecting the database.

params.name: column
params.description: Used to specify the primary key column name.

params.name: generator
params.description: Algorithm used to generate unique identifiers for instances of the persistent CFC.

params.name: sequence
params.description: Sequence key name in the database.

params.name: selectkey
params.description: The column name that is used to retrieve the primary key generated by a database trigger.

params.name: params
params.description:
Additional parameters required by the various generators to generate the ID.
The value for the params attribute should follow the CF Struct syntax. For example: params = {key1='value1', key2='value2'}

params.name: length
params.description: Use this attribute to specify the length of the column. This attribute is used for table creation only.

params.name: precision
params.description: Specifies the precision value.

params.name: index
params.description: Specifies the name of an index that is created using the mapped column

params.name: setter
params.description: Specifies whether to generate setter methods or not

params.name: getter
params.description: Specifies whether to generate getter methods or not

params.name: source
params.description: Specifies the source from where the timestamp has to be retrieved

params.name: elementcolumn
params.description: Column name in the table that is used as value in struct.

params.name: elementtype
params.description: Data type of the value.

params.name: structkeytype
params.description: Specifies the data type of the key, when collectiontype=struct.

params.name: structkeycolumn
params.description: The column in the target table to use as key if the collection type is struct.

params.name: inversejoincolumn
params.description: Specifies the foreign key column in the Join table that references the primary key column in the target table.

params.name: linkschema
params.description: Schema for the link table

params.name: linkcatalog
params.description: Catalog for the link table

params.name: linktable
params.description: Name of the link table

params.name: missingRowIgnored
params.description:
If the value is true, and the row that is referenced by the foreign key is missing, it is treated as a null
association. The default is false, in which case an exception occurs.

params.name: inverse
params.description: A Boolean value that specifies bidirectional association

params.name: orderby
params.description: Specifies the Order By string.

params.name: fkcolumn
params.description: Specifies the foreign key column

params.name: fetch
params.description: Specifies if it is outer-join fetching or sequential select fetching

params.name: cascade
params.description: Specifies which operations should be cascaded from the parent object to the associated object

params.name: constrained
params.description: Whether a constraint is set on this table's Primary Key column to reference the Primary Key in the other table

params.name: unique
params.description: Specifies if there should be a unique constraint on the column.

params.name: uniquekey
params.description: Groups columns in a single unique key constraint.

params.name: notnull
params.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether a notnull constriant should be added for this column.

params.name: update
params.description:
Whether the column should be included in the SQL update statement.
Set update=false and insert=false if the column needs to be read-only.

params.name: insert
params.description:
Whether the column should be included in SQL UPDATE and/or INSERT tatements.
Set update=false and insert=false if the column needs to be read-only.

params.name: generated
params.description:
Specifies that this property value is actually generated by the database {never|always|insert}
* never: Specifies that the value for this property is never generated by database
* always: Specifies that the value for this property is always generated by database
* insert: Specifies that the value for this property is generated at the time of insert but is not regenerated at updates.

params.name: formula
params.description: SQL expression that defines the value of the property.If you specify a formula, the column value is ignored.

params.name: lazy
params.description: Specifies if loading is to be done by parts:

params.name: optimisticLock
params.description: Whether updates to this property require acquisition of the optimistic lock on the table row

params.name: scale
params.description: Specifies the scale value

params.name: mappedby
params.description: Property in the target CFC that is referenced by the foreign key in the Join table.

params.name: cfc
params.description: Name of referenced CFC

params.name: joinColumn
params.description: Use this attribute to define the join column for inheritance mapping.

params.name: validate
params.description: Takes the validator to be used for validating data when implicit setter for this property is called.

params.name: validateParams
params.description:
Takes the parameters required by the validator specified in the validate attribute. 
 This should be specified in the implicit struct notation eg. validateparams="{min=18,max=60}">.

min: Minimum value if validate is integer/numeric/
max: Maximum value if the validate is integer/numeric/
minLength: Minimum length of the string if the validate is string
minLength: Maximum length of the string if the validate is string
pattern: regex expression if the validator specified in validate attribute is regex

params.name: cacheUse
params.description: Type of cache to use

params.name: sqlType
params.description:
Use this attribute to specify the DB-specific SQLType that should be used for the column. This attribute is used for table creation only.
If this attribute is not specified, ColdFusion will automatically decide the SQLType based on the ormtype specified for this property.

params.name: dbDefault
params.description: This sets the default value of a column in the table when schema is exported.

params.name: where
params.description: Where condition

params.name: persistent
params.description:
Specifies whether this property should be persisted. If
persistent="false‚Äù all the ORM related attributes are ignored.
Set this attribute to false if you do not want this property to be persisted by ORM.

params.name: unSavedValue
params.description: An identifier property value that indicates that an instance is newly instantiated and not saved/loaded in the database

params.name: serializable
params.description:
Specifies whether this property can be serialized. If you set this value to
false, the property cannot be serialized, so any changes made are not retained on session replication, and the property has its default value (if any) on the second server. 
Use this attribute to prevent serializaton of properties in CFCs that are serializable.

params.name: singularname
params.description: Use this prperty to define the custom name for generated relationship methods. Applies to one-to-many and many-to-many

params.name: remotingFetch
params.description: If remotingFetch is false, then the value of that attribute is not sent over flash remoting. remotingFetch is true by default was all properties. But in case of cfcs for which persistent = true, the value of the remotingFetch attribute is false by default for any property that shares one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one or many-to-many relationship.

params.name: table
params.description: Table name
